intro: Prinos laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth prion. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. The plant is characterized by its small, smooth, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
